Finance internship is a flagship program giving you a fantastic opportunity to join a fast-paced, growing bank with a reputation for doing things differently. We donâ€™t want another cog in the machine, weâ€™re looking for self-starters and bold thinkers who want to pave their own career paths.

This internship program offers an unparalleled unique opportunity to apply your academic knowledge to gain practical experience in a real-world setting, develop valuable skills, and gain exposure to various aspects of corporate finance.

As a Finance Intern, you will have the chance to work alongside our seasoned financial professionals, gaining hands-on experience in a variety of key areas and contribute to the growth and success of our organization.

You will have a well-rounded exposure to various finance functions and will be assigned to either of the finance functions assisting in financial analysis, budgets, and forecasts, participating in the month-end close process, account reconciliations, supporting preparation of regulatory filings, treasury packs, accounts payable and finance operations and supporting with special projects and ad-hoc tasks. You will also have get an opportunity to be rotated around in different verticals as per requirements.






















Weâ€™re OakNorth Bank and we embolden entrepreneurs to realise their ambitions, understand their markets, and apply data intelligence to everyday decisions to scale successfully at pace.

Banking should be barrier-free. Itâ€™s a belief at our very core, inspired by our entrepreneurial spirit, driven by the unmet financial needs of millions, and delivered by our data-driven tools.

And for those who love helping businesses thrive? Our savings accounts help diversify the high street and create new jobs, all while earning savers some of the highest interest on the market.

But we go beyond finance, to empower our people, encourage professional growth and create an environment where everyone can thrive. We strive to create an inclusive and diverse workplace where people can be themselves and succeed.

Our story

OakNorth Bank was built on the foundations of frustrations with old-school banking. In 2005, when our founders tried to get capital for their data analytics company, the computer said â€˜noâ€™. Unfortunately, all major banks in the UK were using the same computer â€“ and it was broken.

Why was it so difficult for a profitable business with impressive cashflow, retained clients, and clear commercial success to get a loan?

The industry was backward-looking and too focused on historic financials, rather than future potential.

So, what if there was a bank, founded by entrepreneurs, for entrepreneurs? One that offered a dramatically better borrowing experience for businesses?

No more what ifs, OakNorth Bank exists.

Barclays Group Compliance operates as one team to drive the right customer outcomes and protect the integrity of the financial services markets through innovative compliance. The aim is to deliver a global function that satisfies regulatory commitments and promotes regulatory reliance and confidence in the Bankâ€™s chosen markets.

Compliance acts as business partners, and we use our integrity and judgment to influence behaviours in the right way at the right time.



BX Compliance consist of multiple teams which support various Compliance functions including Compliance assurance, Market Surveillance, Financial Crime, Business Oversight Compliance, Compliance Data Analytics, Employee Conduct, Compliance Policies and Framework, Compliance Business and Project Management etc.



The Compliance Intern role is expected to provide support to at least 1 Compliance functions during the span of 8 weeks internship period. The decision of Internship function is driven by multiple components including Employee Skillsets, Requirement of each function etc.

At a high level the purpose of the role is to provide support to the various Compliance functions which could include check and challenge on requirements and internal policies, support /conduct compliance assurance reviews in line with the regulatory/ internal policy requirements, Support Employee/Client Surveillance and Investigation requirements and drive continuous improvement activities across Compliance with a focus on data analysis and insights.

About Suvidha Foundation:
Suvidha Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to driving social impact through technology and innovation. Our mission is to create sustainable solutions that empower communities and foster positive change. We work across various domains, including education, healthcare, and social development, leveraging technology to bridge gaps and improve lives.

Role Overview:
We are looking for motivated and passionate individuals to join our Machine Learning Internship program. This is an excellent opportunity for students or recent graduates to gain hands-on experience in the field of Machine Learning while contributing to meaningful projects that make a difference. As an intern, you will work remotely, collaborating with our experienced team to develop and implement machine learning models and solutions.

Key Responsibilities:
Assist in the development and optimization of machine learning models.
Perform data preprocessing, feature engineering, and exploratory data analysis.
Collaborate with team members to design and implement machine learning algorithms.
Analyze and interpret data to extract actionable insights.
Contribute to the documentation and presentation of project outcomes.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in machine learning.

Skills and Qualifications:
Strong foundation in machine learning concepts and algorithms.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with experience in ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn).
Familiarity with data analysis tools and techniques.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with a remote team.
Perks:

Verified Completion Certificate.
Performance-based Letter of Recommendation (LOR).
Performance-based Letter of Appreciation (LOA).
Hands-on experience in real-world machine learning projects.
Mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals.
An opportunity to contribute to impactful projects with a social cause.
